metadata.title: CVE-2017-7443 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - low.
metadata.description: apt-cacher before 1.7.15 and apt-cacher-ng before 3.4 allow HTTP response splitting via encoded newline characters, related to lack of blocking for the %0[ad] regular expression.

criterions.comment: apt-cacher package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.7.15').
apt-cacher-ng package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3-1').
